description.narrative: The project carried out in West and East Africa aims at improving the status and livelihood of smallholders through better agroforestry and foresty management methods which increase the carbon sequestration potential of small farms and village communities also contributing to climate change mitigation. 'High-value biocarbon development' promoted by the project is a broader concept than mere carbon sequestration and refers to a wide range of development and environmental outcomes produced by forestry agrofor estry and trees (livelihood diversification higher agricultural productivity production of timber and fire wood availability of water carbon trade etc.) The project aims especially at improving the possibilities of smallholders to benefit from the internat ional carbon trade.
